p: The latest report from Finland (Publications of the Prime Minister’s Office, 2020) gives an extensive overview over the initiatives taken to address the 17 UNSDGs since the previous report in 2015. In the report, children and childhood are frequently addressed. Specific actions have been taken to guarantee all children access to quality education through a new act and a new national core curriculum for early childhood education and care. Specific attention is directed towards provision of Sámi language early childhood education and care. Regarding education for sustainability, it is stated that “Sustainable development permeates all levels of education from early childhood education and care through the secondary level (including vocational education and training) and it is also included in the agreement negotiations between the Government and higher education institutions” (Publications of the Prime Minister’s Office, 2020, p. 112).
